dalserver

Class DalTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • dalserver.DalTask

  • public class DalTask
extends java.lang.Object
    The DalTask class provides the capability to execute an external task or program, to be executed as a separate process. Initially this is just a thin layer over the Java Runtime.exec and Process classes, but it provides a place to build more sophisticated tasking facilities later. Only synchronous execution is provided initially.

      Constructor to generate a new task instance.

      • execute

        public java.io.BufferedReader execute()
                               throws DalServerException
        Execute the task, passing the parameters entered earlier. Returns a BufferedReader input stream to read the stdout of the task.
        Throws:
        DalServerException

      • errorStream

        public java.io.BufferedReader errorStream()
        Get a BufferedReader input stream to read the stderr of the already executing task.

      • waitForCompletion

        public int waitForCompletion()
        Wait for task completion and return status.

      • status

        public int status()
        Get the process status. This is zero for a running task, and the process exit status for a completed task.

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Kill the task.
